meanings.definition: To surpass in numbers or strength.
meanings.sent1: The team with more players was outmanning their opponents on the field.
meanings.sent2: During the battle, the army with greater numbers was outmanning the enemy forces.
meanings.sent3: The ants were outmanning the picnic, outnumbering the humans by far.
meanings.sent4: The waves crashing against the shore seemed to be outmanning the rocks, showing their strength.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire was outmanning the efforts of the firefighters, spreading rapidly.

meanings.definition: To have more people or soldiers than the opposing side.
meanings.sent1: The school team was outmanning the visiting team with their larger roster.
meanings.sent2: The kingdom's army was outmanning the rebels, making victory seem certain.
meanings.sent3: The kids were outmanning the adults in the game, surprising everyone with their numbers.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were outmanning the sunny sky, covering it completely.
meanings.sent5: The protesters were outmanning the security forces, chanting loudly in the streets.
